title: Gemma Collins is ‘so iconic’ she's dressing as herself this Halloween
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The GC, AKA Gemma Collins, knows she’s so beloved people will be dressing as her come Halloween.

And if you can’t beat ’em, you might as well join ’em.

Gemma is gearing up for Halloween, because ‘it’s pumpkin season darling’ and speaking to Metro.co.uk the star has let us in on her holiday prep, after returning from a sun-drenched jaunt to Cannes.

‘I love this time of year in the country, it’s pumpkin season,’ she enthused down the line, excited at how cosy the weather was getting.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Speaking about her newfound love of the vegetable in her new health kick which has seen her shed two stone, the 38-year-old added: ‘[I’m eating] pumpkin instead of potato.’

Gemma is living the life right now (Picture: Old Boy’s Club / BACKGRID)

With the fabulosity of Halloween and all the costume drama it brings, after her time on Dancing On Ice – and the prep for the Christmas special – surely the Towie star is readying to douse herself in sparkles and over-the-top costumes for 31 October?

‘I’m so iconic these days I think I’m going to go as myself,’ Gemma said of her Halloween get-up.

In times gone by the likes of Alan Carr have donned an outfit in honour of Gem, so it’s promised there will be a lot of GC’s tricking and treating.

Alan famously dressed as Gemma for Halloween in 2017 (Picture: GC Images)

‘It’s amazing, it’s amazing,’ she continued of people using her as a costume, before bringing the concentration back to her own, ‘I might stick a little bit of blood down my face but apart from that I’ll go at the GC.’

A zombie GC, perhaps? ‘Hell yes, I like that…hell yes.’

Forget the costume, though, Gemma is still reeling from a recent holiday blunder that has encouraged her latest collaboration with TransferWise. It comes after the Diva Forever star recently returned from another glamorous excursion to Mykonos a little lighter in the wallet. And not because she’d spent the week shopping.

Gemma knows a thing or two about acing the holiday (Picture: Instagram)

The poor woman was left short changed when she was stiffed in the currency conversion and seeing as she’s so iconic, she’s relaunched the (Gemma) Collins English Dictionary to help Brits avoid rip-off hidden fees in foreign currency.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Pretty handy if you ask us – and anything Gemma says, we’re going to listen, let’s be honest.

Basically, the thing is a jargon-busting guide told by the newfound currency expert on how to cruise through the airport with more dosh in your wallet.

Say hello to the new and improved dictionary (Picture: TransferWise)

‘Recently I was going on holiday to Mykonos and my friend changed up the money and literally, like, he was so upset when he come back. We was drinking prosecco, as you do, I was like, “oh my god what’s up?” and he goes, “You’re not going to believe it, Gemma I’ve just been charged £80 for commission”.

‘It made him really, really sad and we were in shock. Recently as well, for me, when I was in Cannes I was in a really fancy hotel and long story short we changed hotel and in the rush of all the packing I packed my purse in my case.

‘When I turned up to the hotel I thought “I’ve lost my purse!” but with the Transferwise app you can spend away with the local currency [from your phone].’

The drama of misplaced wallets and £80 down the drain, Gemma admitted her time in Cannes was still the best getaway she’d had ‘all year’.

Advertisement

‘My favourite holiday destination has got to be Cannes honey, it was absolutely amazing,’ she said, as we Googled how cheap flights are for a spot of October sun.

‘It’s classy, there’s no riff raff there, it’s absolutely beautiful, I had an amazing time.’

The GC and TransferWise created The (Gemma) Collins English Dictionary.
